Text: We need a slavery museum like Liverpool has. Colston’s statue can be the first exhibit.

Maybe it’s the shocking footage of police violence on protesters in the US, or maybe it’s the degradation of society by our own racist government... but does anyone else feel like a small, useful and cathartic step would be taking down the Colston statue in the centre? Like, now?
bristol literally have a huge statue of edward colston in the city centre if that doesn’t tell you how much they don’t care i don’t know what does

We do airbrush it out. That's literally what we do now. There's no mention of him being a slave trader on his statue, nothing about it in Colston hall. The most we've got is a tiny exhibition tucked away in a dark room in the M-Shed. Take the statue down, rename the hall.

Any apology is better than none. The partition of India they fuck’d that up. See you’re from Bristol Edward Colston, made a few bob back in the day. Might be a good idea to remove any statue to these evil bastards. Instead of naming buildings road after these people.
that’s why we need more than a statue and streets and a school and a music hall named after Colston.

"SØREN KIERKEGAARD WAS AN EARNEST, brilliant, difficult, vituperative, sensitive, sickly emo brat whose statue in the Valhalla of Sad Young Literary Men is surely the size of a Bamiyan Buddha." Lol, amazing first sentence.
If this happens to the Colston Statue in Bristol City Centre don’t ask me no questions
I agree about Auschwitz and that place is about bearing witness to the horror. Colston’s statue commemorates his achievements. They don’t evoke or even bother trying to evoke the same sensations.
I'd go further. Why hasn't Colston's statue been melted down and recast as a memorial to the victims of slavery?
I wonder if those still associated with Colston will be. Why is that statue not in a museum and hidden away?

Watching the "Katrina Game". Drew's 1st game in the Dome. Rookies Bush, Colston, Harper...all making huge plays. The Gleason statue moment. Will Smith pre-heaven, Michael Vick pre-prison. Classic interviews by Harry Connick, Spike Lee, Archie Manning. Dual blocked kicks
The council should give him Colston’s spot. And also keep his statue as clean as they do that one. Justice for Sam Morley!

Another for #MuseumsUnlocked Bristol was this (unauthorised) intervention at the Statue of Edward Colston by the harbour - “Here and Now” bringing together current and historical accounts of slavery. The figures were originally laid out as if on a ship. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bristolpost.co.uk/news/bristol-news/100-human-figures-placed-front-2122990.amp
Why have Bristol's apologists for slavery not given Colston's statue mask too?

this is part of the issue for me with living in Bristol. On the one hand, a really cool city - nice one Greta Thunberg for dropping in! on the other hand, there is a statue of Colston, a 18th century slaveowner, in the city centre. 1/

This flag was larger than the original. It was carried up the hill by Cpl. Gagnon. Cpl. Gagnon is now buried at Arlington a few hundred yards and within sight of the Marine Memorial flag-raising statue in DC.
Colston’s statue could lie symbolicallon its side on the floor of the museum maybe.
I was thinking more of a museum space than a piece of public sculpture. Colston might have a bit more context if there was a museum of the slave trade near his statue in Bristol centre
Put it beside the Edward Colston statue, I guess? If they're not going to remove the one that celebrates the slave trader.
A visit to the very controversial statue of Edward Colston, a well-known slave trader, seemed fitting when in Bristol for @MemoryStudiesSW – at Edward Colston Statue
Citizens Assembly calls for bigger statue of Edward Colston on College Green for the bantz with Bristol City Council.

Doubt that Christmas Pudding will ever face calls to be banned because of links to the slave trade! Degrees of remoteness are important. 100 human figures placed in front of Colston statue in city centre

@BristolCouncil some of the pedestrian/cycle crossings on the bus gate crossing in the centre (next to the Colston statue) have been put out of use. There's no explanation or visible reason for this, and it's not an acceptable situation on a busy junction. What's going on?
Spat on colston's dead-ass statue today. Felt good.
Put up a statue of Astor & they want to take down Colston's? Eh? #r4today

Congratulations to Scarlett for her performance at the Historical Association Great Debate tonight where she placed 3rd in a very strong field of 12., Judges praised her novel and beautifully delivered speech on why Colston's statue should be removed from Bristol.

Prof Daunton on #Colston statue in Bristol, #Rhodes statue in Oxford @RhodesMustFall, complex legacies of eugenicists and figures such as Charles Dickens, Winston Churchill. It's not hero vs villain. 'Difficult histories' should be approach to ALL histories. #clDifficultHistories
